name.en: Fundamental Physics and Applications of X-ray/Neutron Scattering and Reflection
name.ch: X光/中子散射及反射物理原理與應用

department.ch: 化學工程與材料工程學系

remark.ch: 研究所領域分類:材料類

goal.en: "This course will introduce students the basic knowledge of diffraction, scattering and reflection, as well as other related techniques, of X-ray photons and neutrons. The applications of these techniques will also be the focus of this course. In addition, we will introduce the concepts of condensed matter physics wherever it is appropriate, to further strengthen the horizon and depth of the applications side of the course. The topics selected for this course is aimed for the grad students who have been working or will work on X-ray/neutron diffraction/scattering/reflection-related researches. Nevertheless, undergrad students who are interested in these topics are also welcome."

content.en:
The topics that will be discussed in this course include but are not limited to:
1. Interactions of matter and photons/neutrons
2. Sources of photons and neutrons
3. Symmetry and crystal structure
4. Refraction and reflection from interfaces
5. Kinematic theory of diffraction
6. Dynamic theory of diffraction
7. Resonant scattering
8. Inelastic scattering
9. Applications -- Liquid crystals
10. Applications -- Macromolecule crystallography
11. Applications -- Phonons and neutron scattering
12. Applications -- Dynamics of matter
13. In-depth discussions -- The density operator and correlation functions
14. In-depth discussions -- Mean field theory
